titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Mort Fine Papers PASC.0076
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Arts Library Special Collections staff, additions by Michele James with assistance from Julie Graham, April 2013; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2017 August 28.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-31 09:52:01 -0700.

physdesc.extent: (68 boxes, 1 shoe box, and 1 flat box)

did.abstract: There is little biographical information available about Mort Fine. Morton Fine was born in 1916. He teamed with with David Friedkin in the 1940s and together they collaborated on a number of successful radio, television and motion pictue projects over the years. Among their radio projects are Bold Venture, Crime Classics, Broadway is My Beat, and Suspense. By the 1950s the team made the transistion to motion pictures with credits that included Handle with Care and The Pawn Broker, among others. They eventually produced and developed the televsion series I Spy and The Most Deadly Game. Among the many other Mort Fine credits are the radio programs Adventures of Johnny Fletcher, Adventures of Sam Spade, and Escape; the television series Kojak, McCloud, and Streets of San Francisco; and the motion pictures The Greek Tycoon and Caboblanco. He was twice nominated for an Emmy Award for his work on I Spy, and won the Writers Guild Best Written Drama (with Fridekin) for The Pawnbroker (1966). Mort Fine died in 1991.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mort Fine 1978, 1980, 1984. Additions are the gift of Michael Vernon, 2013.

odd.head: UCLA Catalog Record ID
odd.p: UCLA Catalog Record ID: 9912180873606533

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mort Fine Papers (Collection PASC 76). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Arts Library Special Collections staff. Additions processed by Michele James with assistance from Julie Graham, April 2013.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: There is little biographical information available about Mort Fine. Morton Fine was born in 1916. He teamed with with David Friedkin in the 1940s and together they collaborated on a number successful radio, television and motion pictue projects over the years. Among their radio projects are Bold Venture, Crime Classics, Broadway is My Beat, and Suspense. By the 1950s the team made the transistion to motion pictures with credits that included Handle with Care and The Pawn Broker, among others. They eventually produced and developed the televsion series I Spy and The Most Deadly Game. Among the many other Mort Fine credits are the radio programs Adventures of Johnny Fletcher, Adventures of Sam Spade, and Escape; the television series Kojak, McCloud, and Streets of San Francisco; and the motion pictures The Greek Tycoon and Caboblanco. He was twice nominated for an Emmy Award for his work on I Spy, and won the Writers Guild Best Written Drama (with Fridekin) for The Pawnbroker (1966). Mort Fine died in 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials related to the career of writer and producer, Mort Fine. The bulk of collection are scripts, many in bound volumes, for radio, television and motion picture projects. Also included is a very small amount of production information, clippings, ephemera, stories, articles, and other writings by Fine and a small amount of business correspondence and agreements. Among the many radio projects represented in the collection are the series The Adventures of Johnny Fletcher, The Adventures of Sam Spade, Bold Venture, Broadway's My Beat, and Crime Classics. Television projects include Kojak and The Most Deadly Game among others. Motion Picture projects include Cabo Blanco, Greek Tycoon, The Pawnbroker, That Championship Season, and others.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Radio Projects
Television Projects
Motion Pictures Projects
Project Files
Business Records
Unidentified Projects
Short stories, Articles, and Other Writings

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Collection of Scripts and Production Material for the Television Series I Spy. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library.
Mort Fine Papers. Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by program series titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes scripts and a small amount of production information, mostly in bound volumes. Programs represented include The Adventures of Johnny Fletcher, The Adventures of Sam Spade, Bold Venture, Broadway's My Beat, Cathy and Elliott Lewis On Stage, Crime Classics, Escape, The Front Page, Hallmark Hall of Fame, The Line-Up, Pursuit, Suspense, and other freelance projects. Some of the bound volumes of Bold Venture contain occasional production information.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by program titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Television Projects are scripts primarily in bound volumes. Television programs represented include I Spy, Kojak, The Manhunter, The Most Deadly Game, and Streets of San Francisco, among others. Additionally there is a small amount of clippings and ephemera related to I Spy.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: There is no specific arrangement to the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series contains screenplays, clippings, and publicity materials related to film projects such as The Pawnbroker, Greek Tycoon, and The Next Man. Some of the scripts are in bound volumes and include production information.

did.unittitle: Greek Tycoon (The) - clippings and script cover (3 folders)
Handle With Care - script and production information

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: There is no specific arrangement to the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series includes script material, notes, outlines, and treatments for both produced and unproduced projects. Additionally, there are a small amount clippings, articles, and interviews which may have been used as research for film and television projects.

did.unittitle: Short stories, Articles, and Other Writings

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged alphabetically by titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series includes a number of short stories and article drafts; many are undated. Additionally there is an unidentified typescript manuscript as well as typed pages from other writing projects.
